So I was messing around yesterday and had built a giant monster of trusses and hyper editing it low enough so that it would hit a mountain and spray debris everywhere, but as I'm flying flying rover the western rim of the crater the Armstrong memorial is in, sudenly the trusses start shaking and spinning like a tornado!! And the camera is shaking at the same speed, I can't control the camera at all, and it shakes upwards slowly, and in a sudden moment of panic I hyper edited away like 20 m/s of speed so the ship was suborbital, thinking I could send the kraken to its grave, the kraken nomes the ship all the way into the side of the craters eastern rim, and about forty five or so trusses shot off into a suborbital trajectory, and crashed on the other side of the mÃƒÂ¼n.

My question is, can this be another form of the kraken? Or was my ship just extreme kraken bait?

Probably tasty, tasty Kraken snacks.

But the real question is, would it work as a base destroyer?
I think it happens only when your orbiting really low, and my best guess is that it has something to do with rendering all the surface rocks quickly.

The main problem is that structural parts like trusses have physics glitches that amplify over time. To see this effect to its extreme, build a craft that is comprised of a central mass of some sort with 8 long girders sticking out, a single FL-T200 tank at the end of each girder.
My ship was mostly a long stick of large trusses with two on each side.
